thread.title: Kim Kardashian robbery: Star's chauffeur among 17 arrested by French police over Paris robbery
thread.title_full: Kim Kardashian robbery: Star's chauffeur among 17 arrested by French police over Paris robbery

author: Chloe Chaplain
title: Kim Kardashian robbery: Star's chauffeur among 17 arrested by French police over Paris robbery

persons.name: kim kardashian reuters/eduardo munoz  kim kardashian

text:
36 BST Raid: Kim Kardashian Reuters/Eduardo Munoz 
Kim Kardashian’s chauffeur was one of the 17 people arrested over the Paris robbery of the reality star. 
The driver had transported her around Paris in the days leading up the heist - which saw almost £9million worth of jewels stolen – sparking concerns it may have been an “inside job”. 
French police arrested the group on Monday in a series of coordinated police raids across France. 
Many were known underworld figures aged around 50 and at least three were women, police and judicial sources said. Investigation: French police and a TV crew stand outside the location of the robbery in Paris in October (AP) 
French radio and TV reports on Monday said DNA traces from the scene of the heist led police to the suspects and that they would be held for questioning, possibly for as much as four days. 
A police source told Reuters that one of those detained was Kardashian's chauffeur when she was visiting Paris in October for Fashion Week and that police were trying to establish whether he had passed on information to the gang. Badly shaken: Kim and Kanye (REUTERS) 
Ms Kardashian, 36, was photographed frequently while on the Paris trip, attending fashion shows and parties. She also posted numerous pictures to her social media accounts. 
Jean Veil, a French lawyer for Kardashian, told France 2 television: "She (Kardashian) is very happy, very satisfied and to a certain extent reassured by the efficiency of the French police." Robbery: Police fear it may have been an inside job (AP) 
Thieves wearing ski masks and clothes with police markings burst into the luxury property where Kardashian, who is married to U.S rap star Kanye West, was sleeping in the early hours of Oct. 3. 
They tied her up at gunpoint before making off with her engagement ring and other jewels, police said. 
They fled on bicycles with the jewellery worth $9.5 million. Kim Kardashian posts first selfie of 2017 after social media silence 
The reality star, married to rapper Kanye West, was badly shaken but physically unharmed. 
She has mostly since kept a low public profile but broke her silence on the robbery in a promotional clip for the upcoming season of her reality TV show "Keeping Up With the Kardashians," which was released on Friday. 
A tearful Ms Kardashian told her family: "It makes me so upset to think about it." More about:
